definition: "So" is an adverb that is commonly used to express a manner or degree of something. It often functions as an intensifier, emphasizing or emphasizing the extent or intensity of an action, feeling, or situation. It can also be used to introduce a consequence or result, indicating the reason behind an action or event. Additionally, "so" can serve as a conjunction, connecting clauses or phrases, and as a pronoun, referring to something mentioned or understood.
